instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b lags and  fan spinning high
threads.message:
Checked this board under microscope and found pull down resistor of <CHIP>U3990</CHIP> was corroded, replaced it and it worked fine until i removed its heat sink to apply thermal paste. The fans started spinning fast after i assembled it back.
ran asd and it showed 
ta0p
tc0p
th0p
tm0p failed smc i/o.

i have replaced <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> and checked all the resistors but everything looks fine, i even compared values of <TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q5515</TRANSISTOR> with working board and they all are same but fans are constantly spinning on high rpm.
r

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b lags and  fan spinning high
threads.message:
Check the trackpad flex and connector.
You can also try another trackpad assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b lags and  fan spinning high
threads.message: Does it matters?? Even when nothing is connected it, spins fast

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b lags and  fan spinning high
threads.message: Of course, if the sensor is placed on the trackpad board what you want to happen???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b lags and  fan spinning high
threads.message: Ok, i will post results by tomorrow
